DOC.brief_title: Blind Versus Fiberoptic Intubation Through I-GEL
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction : A supraglottic airway device design maintain clear airway sit , create seal around larynx . It may use elective surgery , airway rescue device fail tracheal intubation , conduit tracheal intubation , emergencies cardiorespiratory arrest , hospital . 'First-generation'supraglottic airway device simple airway tubes laryngeal mask airway ( LMA ) Classic . 'Second generation ' device contain suction port integral bite block , include LMA Proseal i-gel . The I-gel innovate second generation supraglottic airway consider first major development since LMA . The I-gel change face airway management widely use anesthesia resuscitation across globe . It make medical grade thermoplastic elastomer design create non-inflatable , anatomical seal pharyngeal , laryngeal perilaryngeal structure . Pediatrics small adult , number anatomical difference make airway management difficult adult . Predicatably , difference pronounce birth unfamiliar ( non-adult like ) airway encounter neonates infant 1 year age . Aim work To compare use I-gel conduit blind intubation conduit fiberoptic guide intubation child also aim validate use I-gel conduit blind intubation absence fiberoptic lack experience use . Objectives : - To validate I-gel use blind intubate conduit child . - To Estimate duration blind intubation use I-gel duration fiberoptic guide intubation I-gel . Ethical Considerations The study protocol approve Research Ethics Committee . Methodology I . Study design Prospective randomize control trial ( non inferiority design ) II . Study set location The study conduct Children Hospital Cairo University . III . Study population This Study conduct 88 child age one ten year present elective surgical procedure Children Hospital Cairo University . Patient divide two equal group ; group C control group ( n=44 ) group B ( blind ) ( n=44 ) . V. Study Procedures 1 . Randomization ( RCT ) Once enrol study , patient randomly assign two group ; fiberoptic guide ( control ) group ( Group C : n= 44 ) , blind group ( Group B : n=44 ) . Randomization do use computer generate number conceal use sequentially number , seal opaque envelope . 2 . Study Protocol Randomization do computer generate number conceal serially number , opague seal envelope . The detail series unknown investigator group assignment keep asset seal envelope bear case number outside . Prior surgery appropriate number envelope open nurse , card inside determine patient group . All child premedicated oral midazolam 0.5mg/kg Half hour procedure atropine dose 0.02mg/kg ( IM ) . Continuous electrocardiogram ( ECG ) , pulse oximetry , non-invasive arterial blood pressure , temperature monitoring apply patient induced inhalational anesthetic use Sevoflurane + oxygen ( O2 ) I.V line insert . After deepen anesthesia , fentanyl 1Î¼g/kg , muscle relaxant give form atracurium 0.5mg/kg . The absence mydriasis , divergent gaze , haemodynamic motor response jaw thrust manoeuvre use parameter guide adequate depth anesthesia ( 7 ) . Supraglottic I-gel appropriate size ( accord body wight ) insert lubrication K-Y Lubricating Jelly ( Johnson & Johnson Medical Limited , Gargrave , Skipton , UK ) . Air way manoeuvre like jaw thrust head tilt use facilitate insertion . Adequate ventilation confirm adequate chest expansion capnography waveform . If ventilation adequate , SG I-gel secure . In case inadequate ventilation I-gel insertion , airway manoeuvre like adjust head/neck position change depth insertion use improve ventilation.A maximum three SGA insertion attempt allow conventional laryngoscopic intubation perform . After secure SG I-gel , accord patient group ; group C ( control ) , paediatric fibrescope prim appropriate size tracheal tube . The fibrescope introduce I-gel guide tracheal intubation . After insertion tube confirmation position , fiberscope remove In group B ( blind ) ; appropriate size endotracheal tube introduce I-gel blindly . Only smooth intubation without force together manoeuvre necessary correct position tracheal tube allow . Only one attempt blind intubation allow avoid airway injury . Any resistance first attempt tube insertion indicate failure blind tube insertion . In group , second person stabilise SG I-gel set position order prevent unintentional movement intubation procedure removal I-gel . Tube insertion confirm capnography , fibrescope bilateral air entry auscultation connection breathe circuit . To remove SG I-gel successful intubation , breathe circuit disconnect , I-gel withdrawn aid stylet ( stabilizer ) continuous push-pull movement . If saturation fall 92 % , facemask ventilation ventilation via SGA begin fail , indicate secure airway conventional intubation 3 . Measurement tool - Patients demographic data collect ; age , gender , weight , height type surgery . - The success rate number attempt SG I-gel insertion record time take insertion removal face mask appearance end-tidal CO2 monitor connection breathe circuit SG I-gel . - The success rate first attempt intubation time take tube insertion start tube introduction till appearance appearance end-tidal CO2 monitor connection breathe circuit tube record . - Adverse event record ; suspicion aspiration regurgitation , hypoxia , bronchospasm , laryngospasm coughing . Staining blood SG I-gel record , well dental , tongue lip trauma . - Postoperative dysphagia , sore throat hoarseness voice record . VI . Study outcomes 1 . Primary outcome - The success rate first attempt intubation 2 . Secondary outcome ( ) - The success rate SG I-gel insertion - Number trial I-gel insertion maximum three trial . - Time take I-gel insertion . - Time take endotracheal tube insertion .
DOC.criteria: 1 . ASA physical status III 2 . Age ( 26 ) 1 . Known difficulty intubation . ( Airway assessment clinically presence retrognathia , small mandibular cavity , limited neck mandibular mobility presence syndromes associate facial abnormality e.g Pierre Robin sequence , Treacher Collins , Hurler 's Hunter 's syndrome ( mucopolysaccharidoses ) , BeckwithWiedemann syndrome Down 's syndrome . ) 2 . Emergency surgery . 3 . Risk aspiration ( e.g ; full stomach , GERD , CHPS ) . 4 . Respiratory tract infection . 5 . Children fit IGel .
